references.paper_title: Optimal strategies and minimax lower bounds for online convex games
references.reason: This paper establishes foundational results on online convex games, which are relevant to the U-calibration problem studied in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Regret minimization and the price of total anarchy
references.reason: This paper provides a crucial result on calibration error, which is closely related to U-calibration, a central concept in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning in auctions: Regret is hard, envy is easy
references.reason: The Follow-the-Perturbed-Leader algorithm from this paper is a core component of the U-calibration algorithms discussed in the target paper.
This paper introduced the concept of asymptotic calibration, forming a foundational basis for the later U-calibration framework explored in the target paper.

references.paper_title: U-calibration: Forecasting for an unknown agent
references.reason: This paper introduced the notion of U-calibration, which is the central focus and primary motivation of the target paper.
